overview: Topics include concepts, operation and terminology of foreign exchange markets; international investment decision making; sources of and approaches to dealing with foreign exchange exposure; political risk; and international funding mechanisms and decision making in multinational business organisations.
intended learning outcomes: Explain the method of operation and terminology of foreign exchange markets.
Measure and manage foreign exchange risk exposure from the point of view of multinational corporations.
Identify and describe the special problems encountered in international decision making.
Analyse how multinational sources of capital and country-specific risk affect the management of long-term assets and liabilities in an international context.

additional pre-requisite: 620-261 Introduction to Operations Research (2008 or earlier)

Semester 2.Contact hours: One two-hour lecture and one one-hour tutorial per week

Prescribed texts: You will be advised of prescribed texts by your lecturer.
